edits.corrected_text: I could never have been afraid of trusting you,
edits.original_text: I could never have been afraid of trusting you

edits.corrected_text: raising her eyes frankly to his face.
edits.original_text: raising her eyes frankly to his face

edits.corrected_text: I think I would have done so some time ago, if I had known how. But I scarcely know how, even now.
edits.original_text: I think I would have done so some time ago, if I had known how. But I scarcely know how, even now

edits.corrected_text: God bless his wife and him!
edits.original_text: God bless his wife and him

edits.corrected_text: She wept, as she tried to thank him. He reassured her, took her hand as it lay with the trembling roses in it on his arm, took the remaining roses from it, and put it to his lips. At that time, it seemed to him, he first finally resigned the dying hope that had flickered in nobody's heart so much to its pain and trouble; and from that time he became in his own eyes, as to any similar hope or prospect, a very much older man who had done with that part of life.
edits.original_text: She wept, as she tried to thank him. He reassured her, took her hand as it lay with the trembling roses in it on his arm, took the remaining roses from it, and put it to his lips. At that time, it seemed to him, he first finally resigned the dying hope that had flickered in nobody's heart so much to its pain and trouble; and from that time he became in his own eyes, as to any similar hope or prospect, a very much older man who had done with that part of life

edits.corrected_text: He put the roses in his breast and they walked on for a little while, slowly and silently, under the umbrageous trees. Then he asked her, in a voice of cheerful kindness, was there anything else that she would say to him as her friend and her father's friend, many years older than herself; was there any trust she would repose in him, any service she would ask of him, any little aid to her happiness that she could give him the lasting gratification of believing it was in his power to render?
edits.original_text: He put the roses in his breast and they walked on for a little while, slowly and silently, under the umbrageous trees. Then he asked her, in a voice of cheerful kindness, was there anything else that she would say to him as her friend and her father's friend, many years older than herself; was there any trust she would repose in him, any service she would ask of him, any little aid to her happiness that she could give him the lasting gratification of believing it was in his power to render

edits.corrected_text: She was going to answer, when she was so touched by some little hidden sorrow or sympathy — what could it have been? — that she said, bursting into tears again: “O Mr. Clennam!
edits.original_text: She was going to answer, when she was so touched by some little hidden sorrow or sympathy — what could it have been? — that she said, bursting into tears again: “O Mr. Clennam

edits.corrected_text: Good, generous Mr. Clennam, pray tell me you do not blame me.
edits.original_text: Good, generous Mr. Clennam, pray tell me you do not blame me

edits.corrected_text: “I blame you?” said Clennam. “My dearest girl!
edits.original_text: “I blame you?” said Clennam. “My dearest girl

edits.corrected_text: I blame you? No!
edits.original_text: I blame you? No

edits.corrected_text: After clasping both her hands upon his arm, and looking confidentially up into his face, with some hurried words to the effect that she thanked him from her heart (as she did, if it be the source of earnestness), she gradually composed herself, with now and then a word of encouragement from him, as they walked on slowly and almost silently under the darkening trees.
edits.original_text: After clasping both her hands upon his arm, and looking confidentially up into his face, with some hurried words to the effect that she thanked him from her heart (as she did, if it be the source of earnestness), she gradually composed herself, with now and then a word of encouragement from him, as they walked on slowly and almost silently under the darkening trees

edits.corrected_text: “And, now, Minnie Gowan,
edits.original_text: “And, now, Minnie Gowan

edits.corrected_text: at length said Clennam, smiling; “will you ask me nothing?
edits.original_text: at length said Clennam, smiling; “will you ask me nothing

edits.corrected_text: “Oh!
edits.original_text: “Oh

edits.corrected_text: I have very much to ask of you.
edits.original_text: I have very much to ask of you

edits.corrected_text: “That’s well!
edits.original_text: “That’s well

edits.corrected_text: I hope so; I am not disappointed.
edits.original_text: I hope so; I am not disappointed

edits.corrected_text: “You know how I am loved at home, and how I love home. You can hardly think it perhaps, dear Mr. Clennam,
edits.original_text: “You know how I am loved at home, and how I love home. You can hardly think it perhaps, dear Mr. Clennam
